channel.title: Angel sword *my second model*
channel.description:
This is my second model. I didnt do that good...sorry angel sword: Pics: The beggining: [IMG]http://i900.photobucket.com/albums/ac207/gemscape/angelsword1.jpg[/img] After about 2 days: [IMG]http://i900.photobucket.com/albums/ac207/gemscape/angelsword2.jpg[/img] On a character in the 317 game. I really have no idea why the colors are different: [IMG]http://i900.photobucket.com/albums/ac207/gemscape/angelsword3.jpg[/img]
I will release if You guys want me to but I really dont think you do..It's not that good I am not sure how to add models to a 508 server. Maybe one of you could help me. I can only add models to a 317. Thats all I know. My class 8 file in my 508 server is nothing like the one in my 317 server...So idk. 90% me 10% google for a picture

item.title: Angel sword *my second model*
item.dc:creator: @deery50 deery50
item.description:
@deery50 wrote:

the wanderer:

About the color, I believe that is because you didn’t color that white part. If you don’t color it with the mat tool it might do that. Again I might be wrong, but I believe that is the problem.

Oh ok…I guess the gold blade is cool anywho lol. But I did color the part at the handle where there is the angel wings…I colored them yet in the server they are purple

Read full topic

item.title: Angel sword *my second model*
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

About the color, I believe that is because you didn’t color that white part. If you don’t color it with the mat tool it might do that. Again I might be wrong, but I believe that is the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Angel sword *my second model*
item.dc:creator: @deery50 deery50
item.description:
@deery50 wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:5, topic:341957”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=438368.msg3221663#msg3221663 date=1275233914]
Flat, horrible ploygon structure/flow, and uneven. For a beginner, I suppose its good for a trace, but try and move away from tracing and use primitives, they are a LOT better and they are actually both easier and faster once you can use them.
[/quote]
Be easy on him. It could use some work, and primitives are good if your tracing structure is horrible. Which means you have bad drawing fundamentals. Yes if your doing a weapon I encourage primitives, because most swords are just cubes, cylinders, and spheres.
@ Topic I’d like to see a wireframe please.[/quote]
Might try primitives rofl!

Read full topic

item.title: Angel sword *my second model*
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

rip4d:

Flat, horrible ploygon structure/flow, and uneven. For a beginner, I suppose its good for a trace, but try and move away from tracing and use primitives, they are a LOT better and they are actually both easier and faster once you can use them.

Be easy on him. It could use some work, and primitives are good if your tracing structure is horrible. Which means you have bad drawing fundamentals. Yes if your doing a weapon I encourage primitives, because most swords are just cubes, cylinders, and spheres.
@ Topic I’d like to see a wireframe please.

Primitives is right above the create tool. It says primitives. :P. With primitives all you do is create a primitive and move the points around to your liking with the move tool. Or I also like using the scale tool when creating handles when the handle isn’t a straight line. like:
\ /
| |
/ \

Read full topic
